requirements.summary: Remove the profile completion modal component and its display logic from the application
acceptanceCriteria: The profile setup modal no longer appears for any user
Users can access the application without being prompted to complete profile information
No popup requesting name and email is displayed

file_operations.description: Remove the ProfileSetup modal component import, remove all state and logic related to showing the profile setup modal (including showProfileSetup conditional rendering, profileLoading state, and any useGetCallerUserProfile hook usage that determines modal visibility), and remove the ProfileSetup JSX element from the render tree
Add a comment at the top of the file indicating this component is no longer actively used in the main application flow but is preserved for potential future use or reference

requirements.summary: Remove conditional logic that triggers profile completion based on missing user profile data
acceptanceCriteria: Application flow no longer checks for or enforces profile completion
User can navigate freely without profile setup interruptions

file_operations.description: Remove any conditional logic that checks userProfile === null or !userProfile to determine whether to show the profile setup modal. Remove the useGetCallerUserProfile hook call if it's only used for profile setup modal logic. Ensure the main application routing and dashboard access are not gated by profile completion checks

Review and remove any profile completion checks that might redirect users or block navigation based on missing profile data. Ensure authenticated users can navigate to their role-based dashboards without profile setup interruptions
